deeperData.explanationMarkdown: Apache FreeMarker is vulnerable to Code Injection. The `createUnsafeMethodsSet` method in `UnsafeMethods.class` implements a deny list to prevent access to various unsafe methods. However the deny list does not include `java.lang.ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream` and `java.security.ProtectionDomain.getClassLoader` among other unsafe methods. An attacker with template editing permissions can use these methods as part of an attack to access files in the application's classpath and load references to arbitrary classes, ultimately resulting in potential arbitrary code execution.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue. Additionally, while fixed versions may not be vulnerable to this specific issue, the ability to create and edit templates carries inherent security risks, and such permissions should only be given to trusted users.

Reference: [https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/app_faq.html#faq_template_uploading_security](https://freemarker.apache.org/docs/app_faq.html#faq_template_uploading_security)

Note: If this component is included as a bundled/transitive dependency of another component, there may not be an upgrade path. In this instance, we recommend contacting the maintainers who included the vulnerable package. Alternatively, we recommend investigating alternative components or a potential mitigating control.

deeperData.description: jQuery before 3.4.0, as used in Drupal, Backdrop CMS, and other products, mishandles jQuery.extend(true, {}, ...) because of Object.prototype pollution. If an unsanitized source object contained an enumerable __proto__ property, it could extend the native Object.prototype.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `jquery` package is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The `jQuery.extend` and `jQuery.fn.extend` functions defined in many files allow an untrusted object to extend `Object.prototype`. An attacker can modify and add prototype properties to JavaScript objects and can potentially leverage those changes to crash the application or execute remote code.

*Advisory Deviation Notice:* The Sonatype security research team has assessed the CVSS score for this vulnerability to be 7.5 given the nature of prototype pollution and the high impact to data integrity, as opposed to a score of 6.1 reported by [NVD](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-11358).
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

Note: If this component is included as a bundled/transitive dependency of another component, there may not be an upgrade path. In this instance, we recommend contacting the maintainers who included the vulnerable package. Alternatively, we recommend investigating alternative components or a potential mitigating control.

deeperData.description: In jQuery versions greater than or equal to 1.0.3 and before 3.5.0, passing HTML containing <option> elements from untrusted sources - even after sanitizing it - to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods (i.e. .html(), .append(), and others) may execute untrusted code. This problem is patched in jQuery 3.5.0.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `jquery` package is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). Multiple jQuery files as listed below, improperly sanitize HTML input containing `<option>` tags. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by passing crafted input to jQuery's DOM manipulation methods (e.g. `.html()`, `.append()`, etc.) to execute XSS attacks.


*Vulnerable File(s) and Function(s)*:

package/dist/jquery.slim.js

package/dist/jquery.js

package/src/manipulation/wrapMap.js

package/src/manipulation.js

package/src/core.js

package/src/core.js
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

Alternatively, a workaround is provided by [jQuery](https://github.com/jquery/jquery/security/advisories/GHSA-jpcq-cgw6-v4j6):
>To workaround this issue without upgrading, use DOMPurify with its `SAFE_FOR_JQUERY` option to sanitize the HTML string before passing it to a jQuery method.


Note: If this component is included as a bundled/transitive dependency of another component, there may not be an upgrade path. In this instance, we recommend contacting the maintainers who included the vulnerable package. Alternatively, we recommend investigating alternative components or a potential mitigating control.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown: The `jQuery` package is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). The `parseHTML()` function in the `parseHTML.js`, `jquery.js` files allow JavaScript to be executed immediately when it's embedded within the event attributes. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by injecting malicious JavaScript containing events handlers which, when rendered, results in the execution of arbitrary script.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

Note: If this component is included as a bundled/transitive dependency of another component, there may not be an upgrade path. In this instance, we recommend contacting the maintainers who included the vulnerable package. Alternatively, we recommend investigating alternative components or a potential mitigating control.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `jquery-ui` package is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) as it allows JavaScript within the `closeText` parameter of the `dialog()` function. The `dialog.js` does not escape content passed through the `closeText` property. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by injecting  malicious JavaScript through user input. When the input is assigned to the `closeText` property it will result in JavaScript execution when the content is rendered in the browser.

NOTE: This vulnerability has been assigned CVE-2016-7103.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown: We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `jquery` package is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). The `htmlPrefilter` function in `manipulation.js` replaces non-XHTML-compliant tags with compliant tags. A remote attacker can exploit this behavior with an ostensibly benign injection that the replacement functionality will turn into malicious live JavaScript that will execute in a victim's browser context.

NOTE: This vulnerability has been assigned CVE-2020-11022.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.

deeperData.description: In Apache Struts 2.5 to 2.5.14, the REST Plugin is using an outdated JSON-lib library which is vulnerable and allow perform a DoS attack using malicious request with specially crafted JSON payload.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `struts2-rest-plugin` component is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The `struts-plugin.xml` file includes the `JsonLibHandler` content handler by default, which uses the outdated `json-lib` library and doesn't perform sufficient input validation on the json data. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a request that contains a crafted JSON payload which, when processed, can cause a DoS condition.

*Advisory Deviation Notice*
The Sonatype security research team discovered that the vulnerability is present in version 2.1.1 until 2.5.14.1, not in all the versions from 2.5 until 2.5.14.1 as the advisory states.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown:
The application is vulnerable by using this component with `JSON-lib` handler. JSON-lib has been removed by default since 2.5.14.1 as stated in [S2-054](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-054). To determine if `JSON-lib` is enabled, check the `org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.ContentTypeHandler` setting in the `struts-plugin.xml` file. 
	  
Example of JSON-lib enabled:
```
<bean type="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.ContentTypeHandler" name="json" class="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.JsonLibHandler" />

```
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue. 

Workaround:
Use Jackson handler instead of the default JSON-lib handler.
Reference: http://struts.apache.org/plugins/rest/#use-jackson-framework-as-json-contenttypehandler
You can apply this workaround by replacing 
<bean type="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.ContentTypeHandler" name="json" class="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.JsonLibHandler" />
to
<bean type="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.ContentTypeHandler" name="json" class="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.JacksonLibHandler" />
in `struts-plugin.xml` file.

deeperData.description: The REST Plugin in Apache Struts 2.1.1 through 2.3.x before 2.3.34 and 2.5.x before 2.5.13 uses an XStreamHandler with an instance of XStream for deserialization without any type filtering, which can lead to Remote Code Execution when deserializing XML payloads.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown: Apache Struts2 is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE). The `createXStream` method in the `XStreamHandler` class does not properly handle XML payloads. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by uploading a malicious XML document, resulting in RCE when it is deserialized.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component when the REST plugin is enabled.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable. Do not use the old API. If this isn't a viable option, the Struts team recommends the following alternative:

>The best option is to remove the Struts REST plugin when not used. Alternatively you can only upgrade the plugin by dropping in all the required JARs (plugin plus all dependencies).  Another options is to limit th plugin to server normal pages and JSONs only:
>
1. >Disable handling XML pages and requests to such pages
<constant name="struts.action.extension" value="xhtml,,json" />
>
2. >Override getContentType in XStreamHandler
public class MyXStreamHandler extends XStreamHandler { public String getContentType() {
 return "not-existing-content-type-@;/&%$#@";
 }
}
>
3. >Register the handler by overriding the one provided by the framework in your struts.xml
<bean type="org.apache.struts2.rest.handler.ContentTypeHandler" name="myXStreamHandmer" class="com.company.MyXStreamHandler"/><constant name="struts.rest.handlerOverride.xml" value="myXStreamHandler"/>

Reference: [https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-052](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-052)

deeperData.description: Apache Struts versions 2.3 to 2.3.34 and 2.5 to 2.5.16 suffer from possible Remote Code Execution when alwaysSelectFullNamespace is true (either by user or a plugin like Convention Plugin) and then: results are used with no namespace and in same time, its upper package have no or wildcard namespace and similar to results, same possibility when using url tag which doesn't have value and action set and in same time, its upper package have no or wildcard namespace.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown: The Apache Struts `struts2-core` and `struts2-rest-plugin` packages are vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE). The `parseNameAndNamespace()` method in the `DefaultActionMapper` and `RestActionMapper` classes perform insufficient validation when parsing namespace attributes. A remote attacker can exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request, containing a malicious OGNL string in the `namespace` parameter, to an affected endpoint. The attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute malicious code on the server where the application resides.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown:
The application is vulnerable by using this component if it meets the following criteria:
* It defines `Action`s with missing or wildcard namespaces, and associated result(s) are also defined with no namespace.
* It defines `url` tags without `value` and `action` attributes set, or the tags are referred to by `Action`s' with namespaces that are missing or defined with a wildcard.

Note: If you do not meet this criteria, we still strongly suggest upgrading to mitigate the possibility of future configuration changes making the application vulnerable.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

Note: In cases where an upgrade is not possible, Apache has provided a workaround. However, the workaround is acknowledged as temporal and weak, and therefore we do not recommend applying it to the application.

Reference: [https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-057](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-057)

deeperData.description: The Apache Struts REST Plugin is using XStream library which is vulnerable and allow perform a DoS attack when using a malicious request with specially crafted XML payload. Upgrade to the Apache Struts version 2.5.16 and switch to an optional Jackson XML handler as described here http://struts.apache.org/plugins/rest/#custom-contenttypehandlers. Another option is to implement a custom XML handler based on the Jackson XML handler from the Apache Struts 2.5.16.
deeperData.explanationMarkdown: Apache's `struts2-rest-plugin` is vulnerable to a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.  This Struts plugin uses XStream to parse XML requests in a potentially unsafe manner.  A malicious user could exploit this situation by sending the application a specially crafted XML document. A DoS scenario will occur when this tainted XML document is processed by XStream.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: If the application is using struts2-rest-plugin prior to version 2.5.16, the application is vulnerable.  If it is using struts2-rest-plugin 2.5.16 or greater and lower than 6.0.0, then the application is vulnerable if it is using the default `XStream` XML parser.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown:
We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue. If using struts2-rest-plugin prior to version 2.5.16, we recommend upgrading to version 2.5.16. Once your Struts application is using version 2.5.16, change the default XML parser used by struts2-rest-plugin to use the Jackson XML parser in your Struts configuration file (struts.xml).  

Documentation for changing your default settings for struts2-rest-plugin can be found here: [Rest Plugin Configuration](http://struts.apache.org/plugins/rest/#custom-contenttypehandlers)
An example of this can be found here: [rest-showcase example](https://github.com/apache/struts/pull/210/commits/6c5b79c20465ceee31fab19f06c8c908073c6d1e)

Note: If this component is included as a bundled/transitive dependency of another component, there may not be an upgrade path. In this instance, we recommend contacting the maintainers who included the vulnerable package. Alternatively, we recommend investigating alternative components or a potential mitigating control.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown:
The `jquery` package is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). The `htmlPrefilter` function in `manipulation.js` replaces non-XHTML-compliant tags with compliant tags. A remote attacker can exploit this behavior with an ostensibly benign injection that the replacement functionality will turn into malicious live JavaScript that will execute in a victim's browser context.

NOTE: This vulnerability has been assigned CVE-2020-11022.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable by using this component.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown: The Spring Framework is vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE) via deserialization.  The intended behavior of `SerializableTypeWrapper$MethodInvokeTypeProvider` is to allow for the invocation of any method on the Java classpath. Because `SerializableTypeWrapper` is serializable it allows an attacker to embed malicious code, such as `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` via Java reflection, allowing RCE.
deeperData.detectionMarkdown: The application is vulnerable if it allows deserialization of untrusted data.
deeperData.recommendationMarkdown: We recommend upgrading to a version of this component that is not vulnerable to this specific issue.

deeperData.explanationMarkdown: The `org.springframework:spring-core` package is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The `simpleMatch` method in `PatternMatchUtils.class` file performs string-pattern matches in a manner which may lead to an infinite loop for certain inputs. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to cause application crashes, using crafted strings.
